name: Swiftys 11 Trivia Game | Word Play | 10 Questions

questions.text:
EXAMPLE: "I like camping," said Tom ___.  The answer is INTENTLY. 

Note: The spellings are always correct English, although the pronunciation may not be. The hint will tell the number of words and letters.  Also the beginning and last letters IE: S/LY or S/D.  

QUESTION ONE: "There seems to be at least one insect in every English outhouse," said Tom ___.
"Now I can support my canvas," said Tom ___.
questions.explanation:
Easily.

	Artists may use EASELS to support their canvases.

questions.text: "We have no apples, grapes, kumquats or oranges," Tom said ___.
"I'll disperse the playing cards," said Tom ___.
questions.explanation:
Ideally.

	If Tom dispersed the playing cards, He'd say, 'I deal'.

questions.text: "We need more people like Reagan, McDonald and Weasley," said Tom ___.
questions.explanation:
Moronically.

	If you need more people like Reagan, McDonald and Weasley...you need, More Rons.

questions.text: "I won't tell you anything about my salivary glands," said Tom ___.
"You may use lots of detergent in late December," was Tom's ___ comment.
questions.explanation:
Yuletide.

	Late December = Yule + Detergent = Tide --- Yuletide

Winsomely.

	If you lose some...you win some.

Uncannily.

	If it's homemade soup it doesn't come from a can.

questions.text: "Let's take a vacation in the south of France," said Tom ___.
questions.explanation:
Nicely.

	Nice is in the south of France.
